diagnosis.diagnostic_reasoning: The diagnosis of Thiamine-Responsive Megaloblastic Anemia Syndrome (TRMA) was clinically confirmed by the presence of megaloblastic anemia, diabetes mellitus, and bilateral sensorineural deafness. Key evidence supporting the diagnosis includes the patient's reaction to thiamine treatment leading to improvement of anemia and glycemic control, as well as imaging findings indicating ischemic stroke in the territory of the right middle cerebral artery.
